item.description:
Fast paced hike with some elevation. We will hike to Buck Hill, cross 28, hike to 3005 to 3030 onto Hawk Hill then possibly to Love Rock. We can take the Red trail back to the back side of Houghton’s Pond. We hiked this last week and averaged 2 hours.

If you have not hiked before, have a medical condition, or cannot keep pace at 3 mph or more, you may not want to consider this event. Please bring a map of the Hills with in the event you fall behind.

LOCATION: Houghton's Pond, Milton, Ma parking area (I will be parked here). The one with the construction site and playground. Look for a Silver late model Volvo.

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION: http://www.mass.gov/d....

RECOMMENDED GEAR: Water, snacks, food, gloves, proper shoes for hiking, proper clothing for weather conditions. Debra's Cell # - 508-237-4454; use email address, dlh161@gmail.com. I cannot respond to the meetup email from my smartphone.

DIRECTIONS: Address –Houghton’s Pond parking area on Hillside St, Milton, MA 02186 Take Route 93 to Exit 3, Houghton's Pond. Turn right at the stop sign onto Hillside Street. Houghton's Pond is located approximately 1/4 miles on the right; continue onto the Houghton Pond entrance on the right. Or you can take Exit 5 MA 28 Randolph Milton, keep on Randolph St. until you get to set of lights, take left at lights onto Chickatawabut Rd, then left onto Hillside St near the State Police, continue onto the Houghton Pond entrance on the left. Peaks: Great Blue Hill (635 feet). Difficulty Level: Moderately Strenuous. Time: We have averaged about 2 hours. Weather Forecast: Sunny but cold. http://www.weather.co...

CANCELLATION POLICY: Inclement weather (mainly Rain) may cancel the hike. If cancelled, it will be rescheduled a few weeks later. I will not have the time to call everyone, so you'll need access to your email to see if the hike is canceled. I will try to post it 4 hours before the hike.

CODE OF CONDUCT AND DISCLAIMER: As a condition of your voluntary participation in this activity you acknowledge and agree to the following: this activity involves inherent risks that can cause property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death to participants and/or others; you assume all risk associated with this activity; you are responsible for having the necessary knowledge, skills, abilities, clothing, and equipment to safely participate in this activity; you know and will follow the Hiker Responsibility Code described at www.hikesafe.com; the leader(s) of this activity are volunteers; and you release, hold harmless, and indemnify the leader(s) and all members of this group from any and all claims for property damage, injury, illness, disability, and/or death - including those caused by negligence and/or other reasons. * Weather can change quickly. Weather conditions which normally do not appear problematic can be when the body is stressed by hard exercise. You can develop hypothermia or hyperthermia very easily at any outside temperature.
item.how_to_find_us: Debra's Silver Volvo at the Houghton Pond parking area near the playground.

group.name: South Shore Hike, Bike & Social Club

item.name: Saturday Hike Blue Hills to Hawk Hill - Fast with some Elevation
